०१ इयं दुरुक्तात्परिबाधमाना वर्णम् ...{Loading}... इयं दुरुक्तात्परिबाधमाना वर्णं पवित्रं पुनती न आगात् प्राणापानाभ्यां बलमाविशन्ती सखा देवी सुभगा मेखलेयमिति त्रिर्मेखलां प्रदक्षिणं त्रिः परिवेष्ट्य १ Oldenberg ...{Loading}... ‘Here has come to us, protecting (us) from evil words, purifying our kin as a purifier, clothing herself, by (the power of) inhalation and exhalation, with strength, this friendly goddess, this blessed girdle’ - with these words, three times repeated, he ties the girdle from left to right thrice round.

Mitra art thou by right, Agni is thy teacher, and I, N.

०१ आपो नाम स्थ ...{Loading}... आपो नाम स्थ शिवा नाम स्थोर्जा नाम स्थाजरा नाम स्थाभया नाम स्थामृता नाम स्थ तासां वोऽशीय सुमतौ मा धत्तेत्येवं त्रिरप आचमय्य १ Oldenberg ...{Loading}... 1 1 . ‘Waters are ye by name; happy ones are ye by name; sappy ones are ye by name; undecaying ones are ye by name; fearless ones are ye by name; immortal ones are ye by name. Of you, being such, may I partake; receive me into your favour’ - with these words (the teacher) makes the student sip water three times,

In the forest, with a piece of wood in his hand, seated, he performs the Sandhyā (or twilight devotion) constantly, observing silence, turning his face north-west, to the region between the chief (west) point and the intermediate (north-western) point (of the horizon), until the stars appear, ०२ अतिक्रान्तायां महाव्याहृतीः सावित्रीम् .
